A: He begins amid Fox News Alert coverage and maps of Russian cities, but quickly pivots to argue the Chinese Communist Party is the real threat. He criticizes “rearview mirror” policy and highlights U.S. dependence on China. He proposes ending the Russia–Ukraine war to split Putin from Xi as the best deterrent against a Taiwan move, asserting he’s the only candidate offering a concrete plan.
Answer: The passage indicates that Vivek Ramaswamy starts by discussing the Russia/Wagner story in relation to news alerts and maps of Russian cities. However, he quickly shifts attention to the Chinese Communist Party as the greater threat, criticizing a "rearview mirror" approach to foreign policy and highlighting the United States' dependence on China. He also proposes using the end of the Russia-Ukraine war as a way to split Putin from Xi Jinping and use this as a deterrent against a potential Taiwan move, stating that he is the only candidate with a concrete plan for addressing these issues.
